Hi Community,

can anyone help with the css/hubl that would need to be added in order to only have certain sections of the content in this grid be gray like in the example I have attached?<http://5631553.hs-sites.com/-temporary-slug-cc3f693a-fedf-44dc-996b-bdac805122de?hs_preview=pbUmkgRZ-10700930123>
You would use a boolean to toggle the gray in the module or use css nth-child to change the color for every other item

If you're using a custom module with a repeater for those sections you could also use cycle (<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/for-loops#cycle>) to alternate class names (e.g. class="{% cycle 'white','gray' %}").
you'll also want to use flexbox on each row and object fit on the images in order to get equal heights and the image sizing correct
or use stretch, with image set to cover
or? stretch is a flexbox property and cover is an object fit property :wink:
FIGHT FIGHT FIGHT!!!!

you are correct. I was meaning 2 columns  in a container - container is flex, with align items stretch to match height, column with image is using the image as a background image with size cover(definitely depends on how youâ€™re using the image though for accessibility.)
not saying your way was wrong in any way, probably better actually depending on the type of image being used

Hey Guys I created a custom global module to be used as a Navigation bar. What would be the best way of creating multiple variants (transparent/ light / dark etc).
Currently I have multiple clones of the module but when there is a change I have to edit all modules one by one. Kind of a pain and prone to bugs
I would assign a class to the menu, and do it that way. Are you using the `menu()` function or the `{% menu %}` module?

If you need the user to be able to select which option they want on a page by page basis you could also create a custom module with three options and then add in different styles for that header class based on their selection.
Thanks for the replies. I used custom HTML markup as I needed full control over the classes. (Using a Bootstrap theme) so not using the menu function.
I will change the global module so it's a regular module that can be changed on a page by page level. And add custom classes as you guys suggested.
Thanks
